abstracts.cdata!:
The Government of Iran requested in the
            late 1950s a loan from the Bank for the development of the
            Khuzestan area in the southwest of Iran. The Dez irrigation
            area is located in the upper Khuzestan on both banks of the
            Dez river, about 120 kilometer (km) north of Ahwaz and has
            about 125,000 hectares of irrigable land. Land leveling and
            the re-alignment, improvement and construction of farm
            irrigation channels, which were to be the responsibility of
            the land owners with technical assistance provided by
            consultants under the project, were delayed due to changes
            brought about by the land reform program in the 1960s. The
            next phase in the development of the project area, which
            came to be called stage one, included the construction of a
            re-regulating dam and a diversion dam near Dezful with
            canals, drains, irrigation distribution systems, flood
            protection works, and maintenance roads to serve an
            additional 37,000 hectares. In early 1972, the Bank
            appraised what was called stage two of the total project
            area. This was envisaged as a project to provide irrigation
            to the remaining 27,000 hectares not covered under other
            projects, thus fully utilizing the irrigation water
            resources of the Pahlavi dam. In 1972 the International
            Finance Corporation approved a loan of United States (U.S.)
            l. 25 million dollars for one of the agribusinesses involved
            in the project area. The agribusinesses in the project area
            were partly financed later on with Bank funds through two of
            the three loans to what came to be called the Agricultural
            Development Bank of Iran. This project completion report
            relates specifically to Loan 594-IRN which helped finance
            stage one. This report makes extensive reference to all
            aspects in its effort to comprehend the results of
            irrigation development in the Khuzestan area.
